articles.title: hello world
articles.contents:
bio
I am a researcher in-training at the University of Pittsburgh.
My research interests center on how we learn and process the sounds that we hear.
trivia
The github repository for this website, myomyrus, is named after Myomyrus rume, weakly electric elephant-nose fish hailing from South Africa. My research journey started with studying how these creatures learned spatial information.
I have been electrocuted by lively specimens of Malapterurus electricus, African electric catfish, on multiple occasions. It was electrifying.
contact
lez35@pitt.edu

articles.title: research
articles.contents:
My research is in auditory perceptual learning. Iâ€™m interested in how we learn and process the sounds that we hear.
Here is some of my recent work.
comorbidities & hearing loss in veterans
presented at JDVAC 2021
More and more veterans returning from Iraq and Afghanistan are complaining of having hearing problems, but their hearing tests are typically normal. Might their comorbidities explain their hearing problems?
